grading_system.description: No specific grading system verified from official sources. Lake County Environmental Health provides inspection reports but grading methodology not found.

inspection_details.frequency: Risk-based: restaurants inspected at least 3 times per year, larger grocery stores 2-3 times annually, low-risk facilities less frequently, with everyone receiving at least one inspection per year
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Major critical violations must be corrected and may require follow-up inspection
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports available by location and name via PDF downloads on county website

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Lake County Fire Protection District and local fire departments

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (part of California Health and Safety Code)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - Lake County Environmental Health personnel conduct all inspections and issue permits for retail food operations
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: No specific local ordinances identified beyond state code compliance

confidence_notes: No grading system (letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail) could be verified from official Lake County sources. Inspection frequency and violation reporting system confirmed, but specific grading methodology not found.
verification_notes: Manual verification needed to confirm: 1) Whether Lake County uses any grading system (A/B/C, numerical scores, pass/fail), 2) Specific fire department requirements for commercial kitchen hood systems and suppression systems, 3) Exact inspection scoring methodology and public disclosure requirements.
